# Question

Given a DataFrame `df` with column `dt` representing DateTimes. Write a function `add_yearmonth` that creates a new column `ym` by extracting year and month from `dt` and concatenating them together as an integer in format: “yyyymm”.

Here is the Julia code that accomplishes this task:

```julia
using DataFrames, Dates

function add_yearmonth(df::DataFrame)
    df[:ym] = [Dates.format(d, "yyyyMM") for d in df.dt]
end
```
The `add_yearmonth` function takes a dataframe as an argument and adds a new column (`:ym`) to it. The values of this new column are generated from the original date-time column (`df[:dt]`). The format "yyyyMM" is used, which represents year and month in four-digit and two-digit formats respectively.

Please note that this function modifies the input dataframe `df` directly. Also, make sure you've added `Dates` module to your code as it is necessary for date manipulations in Julia.
